meanings.definition: Vulcanizers (noun): Devices used to heat and cure rubber to increase its strength and durability.
meanings.sent1: The factory workers used vulcanizers to make the rubber stronger.
meanings.sent2: The vulcanizers in the workshop were essential for making durable tires.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey accidentally turned on the vulcanizers, causing a rubbery mess.
meanings.sent4: The vulcanizers worked their magic on the rubber, transforming it into a resilient material.
meanings.sent5: The hissing sound of the vulcanizers filled the air as they hardened the rubber.

meanings.definition: Vulcanizers (verb): To treat rubber with heat and sulfur to improve its properties.
meanings.sent1: The technician would vulcanize the rubber to enhance its quality.
meanings.sent2: It is important to vulcanize the material for better performance.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally vulcanized the rubbery dessert, creating a unique dish.
meanings.sent4: She hoped to vulcanize her skills through practice and dedication.
meanings.sent5: The process of vulcanizing the rubber made it more resilient and durable.
